result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daraon T Moore

defendant.name: Moore, Daraon T
defendant.address: 5836 West Betty Lane, Brown Deer, WI 53223

records.addlTxt: No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daraon T Moore in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Daraon T Moore.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 097725,
Payable Number: 1038622,
Receipt Number: 22RP041173,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/20/22 @ 2p
